instructions: Line a small baking pan with foil; coat the foil with nonstick cooking spray.
In a small bowl, combine the syrup, soy sauce and garlic.
Place fillets skin side down on prepared pan.
Brush half of the syrup mixture over salmon.
Broil 6-8 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with fork.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, bring the broth, mushrooms and pepper to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer 5-6 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.
Cover and remove from the heat; let stand for 5 minutes.
title: Maple Salmon with Mushroom Couscous
steps: Line a small baking pan with foil; coat the foil with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the syrup, soy sauce and garlic. Place fillets skin side down on prepared pan. Brush half of the syrup mixture over salmon. Broil 6 in. from the heat for 7 minutes. Brush with remaining syrup mixture. Broil 6-8 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with fork.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, bring the broth, mushrooms and pepper to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 5-6 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Return to a boil. Stir in couscous. Cover and remove from the heat; let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Serve with salmon.
